definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: Can't the meeting get rid of in this spot after the another place falls dead?
sentences.chinese: 会不会是在别的地方摔死后扔弃在这个现场的？

sentences.english: Clear a little clutter by getting rid of something you don’t need.
sentences.chinese: 通过扔弃不需要的东西来清理散乱的杂物。

sentences.english: Initially, it costs the consumer nothing to throw away a plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 起初，消费者随意的扔弃一个塑料袋都不以为然。

sentences.english: Those Type 59s that don't get upgraded are being scrapped.
sentences.chinese: 那些59式没有得到升级正在被扔弃。

sentences.english: The used wipes shall be discarded. Never allow reuse .
sentences.chinese: 请将用过的湿巾扔弃，不可冲洗重复使用。

sentences.english: Some have even run through the stores trashing them.
sentences.chinese: 一些人甚至在逛家乐福时将商品扔弃在一旁。

sentences.english: And in some cases, remains had even been tossed aside into a massive pile.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，英雄的遗体甚至被扔弃在集体墓地中。

definition: to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
to browse and select/to glance through and check
trash/refuse/garbage/(coll.) of poor quality/Taiwan pr. [le4 se4]
